# Socio-demographic and economic characteristics 

## `Living with relatives`

### Description of DataSchema variable `Are living in home with family members/relatives (= daily contact with family member)?`

The description of harmonised variable is the following:
  
* Name: `home_rel`
* Label: `Are living in home with family members/relatives (= daily contact with family member)?`
* Type: categorical
* Categories: 
    + `0 = no`
    + `1 = yes`
* Missings: 
    + `991 = CAPI/interviewer error`
    + `992 = Impute`
    + `993 = Disable to measure`
    + `994 = Not attempt/not done/not yet recorded`
    + `995 = Don't answer`
    + `996 = Not applicable`
    + `997 = Refuse`
    + `998 = Do not know`
    + `999 = Missing`



### MHAS - Wave 1

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `trh6`
* Label: `Relationship of household member to selected person`
* Categories:
    + `02 = spouse`
    + `03 = child`
    + `04 = stepchild`
    + `05 = adoptive child`
    + `06 = foster child`
    + `07 = parent`
    + `08 = parent-in-law`
    + `09 = grandparent`
    + `10 = grandchild`
    + `11 = great-grandchild`
    + `12 = child-in-law`
    + `13 = sibling/stepsibling`
    + `14 = sibling-in-law/cousin`
    + `15 = ancle/aunt`
    + `16 = nephew/niece`
    + `17 = other relative`
    + `18 = non-relative`
    + `66 = selected person died`
    + `00 = without spouse`
        

```{r assign1}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'MHAS_w1_home_rel','Mexican Health Aging Study.sect_trh',
                         variables=list('trh6'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local1}
MHAS_w1_home_rel <- opal.execute(o,'MHAS_w1_home_rel')
Categorical_summary(var = MHAS_w1_home_rel$trh6, missing_values = NA)
ggplot(MHAS_w1_home_rel, aes(x=factor(trh6))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Relationship of household member to selected person") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To recode the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:  

* `from 2 to 17 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

R code of the ALGORITHM:

```{r harmo1}
MHAS_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=MHAS_w1_home_rel$id)
MHAS_ds_w1$home_rel <- car::recode(as.vector(MHAS_w1_home_rel$trh6), "2:17='1'; 18='0'; 0='0'; 66='0'; NA='999'")
MHAS_ds_w1$home_rel <- labelled(MHAS_ds_w1$home_rel, labels = c("No"=0, "Yes"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Don't answer"=995,  "Not attempt/not done/not yet recorded"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI/interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript1}
Categorical_summary(var = MHAS_ds_w1$home_rel, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(MHAS_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(home_rel))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Are living in home with family members/relatives (= daily contact with family member)?") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation1}
AfterH <- table(MHAS_ds_w1$home_rel)
BeforeH <- table(MHAS_w1_home_rel$trh6, useNA='ifany')
BeforeH[[1]] <- sum(BeforeH[c(1,18,19)])
BeforeH[[2]] <- sum(BeforeH[c(2:17)])
BeforeH[[3]] <- BeforeH[[length(BeforeH)]]
BeforeH <- BeforeH[c(1,2,3)]
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0","1","NA->999")
C
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To recode the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:  
  
* `if trh9_12 in 2:16 or ntrh6_12 in 3:17 then 1`
* `NA into 999`

R code of the ALGORITHM:
  
```{r harmo3}

same_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  colnames(new_2) <- colnames(old)
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], rep_len(NA,dim(old)[2]-1))
    }
  }
  new_2 <- data.frame(new_2)
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2$id, trh9_12=new_2$trh9_12, ntrh6_12=new$ntrh6_12) 
                       # id = new_2$id
                       # colname_form_OLD_table = new_2$colname_form_OLD_table 
                       # colname_form_NEW_table = new$colname_form_NEW_table
  new_22
}

# old = MHAS_w3_home_rel1 (trh9_12)
# new = MHAS_w3_home_rel2 (ntrh6_12)

MHAS_w3_home_rel <- same_indiv(MHAS_w3_home_rel1, MHAS_w3_home_rel2)

MHAS_ds_w3 <- tibble(id=MHAS_w3_home_rel$id)

MHAS_w3_home_rel$trh9_12 <- car::recode(as.vector(MHAS_w3_home_rel$trh9_12), "NA='-999'")
MHAS_w3_home_rel$ntrh6_12 <- car::recode(as.vector(MHAS_w3_home_rel$ntrh6_12), "NA='-999'")

MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel <- c(NA) # I think it is required
for(i in 1:dim(MHAS_w3_home_rel)[1]){
  if( MHAS_w3_home_rel$trh9_12[i] %in% c(2:16) | MHAS_w3_home_rel$ntrh6_12[i] %in% c(3:17) ) {
    MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel[i] = 1 }
  else if( MHAS_w3_home_rel$trh9_12[i] == -999 & MHAS_w3_home_rel$ntrh6_12[i] == -999 ) {
    MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel[i] = 999 }
  else if( MHAS_w3_home_rel$trh9_12[i] ==17 | MHAS_w3_home_rel$ntrh6_12[i] ==18 ) {
    MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel[i] = 0 }
}

MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel <- car::recode(as.vector(MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel), "NA='999'")
MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel <- labelled(MHAS_ds_w3$home_rel, labels = c("No"=0, "Yes"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Don't answer"=995,  "Not attempt/not done/not yet recorded"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI/interviewer error"=991))
```
